message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.DL 

This paper deals with the task of identifying translations among a large number of candidates using a statistics-based approach. This task falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP) and information retrieval (IR), which are covered by the sub-categories cs.CL and cs.IR. The paper also uses a vector representation of documents and measures semantic similarity, which are techniques commonly used in machine learning and artificial intelligence (AI), covered by the sub-category cs.AI. The system's performance is evaluated using precision, which is a common evaluation metric in machine learning and data analysis, covered by the sub-category cs.LG. Finally, the paper mentions the use of a multilingual thesaurus, which is a resource commonly used in deep learning and natural language processing, covered by the sub-category cs.DL.
